# Withered Leaves & Spoiled Fruits
https://thepalmerworm.substack.com

## About

Withered Leaves & Spoiled Fruits is a Substack publication by Christine Jones that offers critical commentary on modern culture, education, philosophy, and societal trends. The publication examines how seemingly compassionate ideas and progressive movements can lead to destructive outcomes.

Author: Christine Jones
Bio: Christine has 25 years in the field as Teacher, Advisory Teacher, Director, Conductor, Training Provider, Presenter & Researcher.
Subscribers: 719+ subscribers

Tagline: "An everyday glance into our embracing of destructive ideas, their withered leaves and spoiled fruits."

The title references the biblical passage: "The multitude of your gardens and your vineyards and your fig trees and your olive trees hath the palmer worm devoured." (Amos IV.9)

## Topics Covered

- Critical analysis of progressive education philosophy (Dewey, Wundt, Freire)
- Examination of critical theory, deconstruction, and queer theory in education
- Cultural commentary on propaganda, media manipulation, and mass formation
- Philosophy of education and human nature
- Government overreach and tyranny
- Loss of critical thinking in modern society
- C.S. Lewis's concept of "men without chests" and dehumanization
- Analysis of well-intentioned policies with negative consequences

## Content Themes

The publication focuses on:
- How utopian ideals and compassionate-sounding initiatives can lead to harmful outcomes
- The erosion of critical thinking and discernment in modern society
- The consequences of progressive education methods on human development
- Propaganda, mass formation, and the loss of natural immunity to manipulation
- The gap between good intentions and actual consequences

## Notable Articles

- "Masked Intent" (December 2021) - On critical thinking, propaganda, and the events of 2020
- "That Richt Balulalow" (January 2023) - On C.S. Lewis, education, and dehumanization
- "The Scholars of Verdantia and the Art of Foraging" (February 2025) - Allegorical narrative about truth and wisdom
- "Human Nature; de te fabula narratur" (July 2024)
- "Veiling The Charter: Part 2" (March 2025)

## Site Structure

- Homepage: https://thepalmerworm.substack.com
- Archive: https://thepalmerworm.substack.com/archive
- Author Profile: https://substack.com/@thepalmerworm
- Related Publication: "The Reason We Learn"

## Key Concepts

1. **Withered Leaves & Spoiled Fruits**: The visible consequences of destructive ideas
2. **The Palmer Worm**: A biblical metaphor for gradual destruction and decay
3. **Men Without Chests**: C.S. Lewis's concept describing people lacking emotional depth and moral sentiments
4. **Mass Formation**: The phenomenon of collective delusion and conformity
5. **Disenchantment**: The removal of meaning and glory from the world through modern educational methods

## Writing Style

- Philosophical and analytical
- References classical literature and thinkers
- Uses allegorical storytelling
- Critical of mainstream narratives
- Emphasizes consequences over intentions
- Draws from biblical and historical references

## Audience

Readers interested in:
- Educational philosophy and reform
- Cultural criticism
- Traditional values and wisdom
- Critical analysis of modern progressive movements
- Philosophy of human nature
- Resistance to propaganda and manipulation

## Content Format

- Long-form essays
- Allegorical narratives
- Cultural commentary
- Philosophical analysis
- Multi-part series

---

Note: This Substack requires JavaScript to view the full archive. Individual articles are accessible via direct URLs.
# Withered Leaves & Spoiled Fruits
https://thepalmerworm.substack.com

## About

Withered Leaves & Spoiled Fruits is a Substack publication by Christine Jones that offers critical commentary on modern culture, education, philosophy, and societal trends. The publication examines how seemingly compassionate ideas and progressive movements can lead to destructive outcomes.

Author: Christine Jones
Bio: Christine has 25 years in the field as Teacher, Advisory Teacher, Director, Conductor, Training Provider, Presenter & Researcher.
Subscribers: 719+ subscribers

Tagline: "An everyday glance into our embracing of destructive ideas, their withered leaves and spoiled fruits."

The title references the biblical passage: "The multitude of your gardens and your vineyards and your fig trees and your olive trees hath the palmer worm devoured." (Amos IV.9)

## Topics Covered

- Critical analysis of progressive education philosophy (Dewey, Wundt, Freire)
- Examination of critical theory, deconstruction, and queer theory in education
- Cultural commentary on propaganda, media manipulation, and mass formation
- Philosophy of education and human nature
- Government overreach and tyranny
- Loss of critical thinking in modern society
- C.S. Lewis's concept of "men without chests" and dehumanization
- Analysis of well-intentioned policies with negative consequences

## Content Themes

The publication focuses on:
- How utopian ideals and compassionate-sounding initiatives can lead to harmful outcomes
- The erosion of critical thinking and discernment in modern society
- The consequences of progressive education methods on human development
- Propaganda, mass formation, and the loss of natural immunity to manipulation
- The gap between good intentions and actual consequences

## Notable Articles

- "Masked Intent" (December 2021) - On critical thinking, propaganda, and the events of 2020
- "That Richt Balulalow" (January 2023) - On C.S. Lewis, education, and dehumanization
- "The Scholars of Verdantia and the Art of Foraging" (February 2025) - Allegorical narrative about truth and wisdom
- "Human Nature; de te fabula narratur" (July 2024)
- "Veiling The Charter: Part 2" (March 2025)

## Site Structure

- Homepage: https://thepalmerworm.substack.com
- Archive: https://thepalmerworm.substack.com/archive
- Author Profile: https://substack.com/@thepalmerworm
- Related Publication: "The Reason We Learn"

## Key Concepts

1. **Withered Leaves & Spoiled Fruits**: The visible consequences of destructive ideas
2. **The Palmer Worm**: A biblical metaphor for gradual destruction and decay
3. **Men Without Chests**: C.S. Lewis's concept describing people lacking emotional depth and moral sentiments
4. **Mass Formation**: The phenomenon of collective delusion and conformity
5. **Disenchantment**: The removal of meaning and glory from the world through modern educational methods

## Writing Style

- Philosophical and analytical
- References classical literature and thinkers
- Uses allegorical storytelling
- Critical of mainstream narratives
- Emphasizes consequences over intentions
- Draws from biblical and historical references

## Audience

Readers interested in:
- Educational philosophy and reform
- Cultural criticism
- Traditional values and wisdom
- Critical analysis of modern progressive movements
- Philosophy of human nature
- Resistance to propaganda and manipulation

## Content Format

- Long-form essays
- Allegorical narratives
- Cultural commentary
- Philosophical analysis
- Multi-part series
